refnamediv.refpurpose: The basic, generic Bonobo object factory implementation

refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis
refsynopsisdiv.synopsis: BonoboObject * (*BonoboFactoryCallback) (BonoboGenericFactory *factory, const char *component_id, gpointer closure); BonoboGenericFactory * bonobo_generic_factory_new (const char *act_iid, BonoboFactoryCallback factory_cb, gpointer user_data); BonoboGenericFactory * bonobo_generic_factory_new_closure (const char *act_iid, GClosure *factory_closure); BonoboGenericFactory * bonobo_generic_factory_construct (BonoboGenericFactory *factory, const char *act_iid, GClosure *factory_closure); void bonobo_generic_factory_construct_noreg (BonoboGenericFactory *factory, const char *act_iid, GClosure *factory_closure); int bonobo_generic_factory_main (const char *act_iid, BonoboFactoryCallback factory_cb, gpointer user_data); int bonobo_generic_factory_main_timeout (const char *act_iid, BonoboFactoryCallback factory_cb, gpointer user_data, guint quit_timeout); #define BONOBO_FACTORY_INIT (descr, version, argcp, argv) #define BONOBO_OAF_FACTORY (oafiid, descr, version, callback, data) #define BONOBO_OAF_FACTORY_MULTI (oafiid, descr, version, callback, data) #define BONOBO_ACTIVATION_FACTORY (oafiid, descr, version, callback, data) #define BONOBO_ACTIVATION_FACTORY_TIMEOUT (oafiid, descr, version, callback, data, quit_timeout)

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The vast majority of Bonobo objects are created by the BonoboGenericFactory implementation. This provides a very simple C sugar wrapper of the GNOME::ObjectFactory IDL interface, used by OAF to instantiate new objects.

Most applications when they start up will register their Bonobo object factory with OAF, this can be done like this:
How to register a factory with OAF
BonoboGenericFactory *factory; factory = bonobo_generic_factory_new ( "OAFIID:GNOME_MyApp_myId", my_factory_function, NULL); bonobo_running_context_auto_exit_unref (BONOBO_OBJECT (factory));
This registers the factory with OAF, associated with your factory's OAFIID ( as specified in the installed .oaf file ). The running_context_auto_exit_unref function is used to ensure that the program exits the gtk main loop when all of the factory's ( or any derived ) objects are destroyed.
There is a macro that can be used for simple components to remove the burden of writing the main function and getting the initialization correct, see BONOBO_ACTIVATION_FACTORY.

refsect2.title: BonoboFactoryCallback ()
refsect2.para: Type of function that is called when it's time for the factory to create a new instance.

listitem.simpara: the factory that invoked this callback
OAFIID of the component that should be activated

refsect2.title: bonobo_generic_factory_new ()
refsect2.para: This is a helper routine that simplifies the creation of factory objects for GNOME objects. The factory function will be invoked by the CORBA server when a request arrives to create a new instance of an object supporting the Bonobo::Generic interface. The factory callback routine is passed the data pointer to provide the creation function with some state information.

listitem.simpara: The GOAD id that this factory implements
A callback which is used to create new BonoboObject instances.
The closure data to be passed to the factory callback routine.
A BonoboGenericFactory object that has an activated Bonobo::GenericFactory object that has registered with the GNOME name server.

refsect2.title: bonobo_generic_factory_new_closure ()
refsect2.para: This is a helper routine that simplifies the creation of factory objects for GNOME objects. The factory_closure closure will be invoked by the CORBA server when a request arrives to create a new instance of an object supporting the Bonobo::Generic interface. The factory callback routine is passed the data pointer to provide the creation function with some state information.

listitem.simpara: The GOAD id that this factory implements
A closure which is used to create new BonoboObject instances.
A BonoboGenericFactory object that has an activated Bonobo::GenericFactory object that has registered with the GNOME name server.

refsect2.title: bonobo_generic_factory_construct ()
refsect2.para: Initializes c_factory with and registers the new factory with the name server.

listitem.simpara: The Bonobo activation id that the new factory will implement. Bonobo::GenericFactory interface and which will be used to construct this BonoboGenericFactory Gtk object.
The initialized BonoboGenericFactory object or NULL if already registered.

refsect2.title: bonobo_generic_factory_construct_noreg ()
refsect2.para: Initializes c_factory with the supplied closure and iid.

listitem.simpara: The GOAD id that the new factory will implement.

refsect2.title: bonobo_generic_factory_main ()
refsect2.para: A Generic 'main' routine so we don't stick a load of code inside a public macro. See also bonobo_generic_factory_main_timeout().

listitem.simpara: the oaf iid of the factory

refsect2.title: bonobo_generic_factory_main_timeout ()
refsect2.programlisting: int bonobo_generic_factory_main_timeout (const char *act_iid, BonoboFactoryCallback factory_cb, gpointer user_data, guint quit_timeout);
refsect2.para: A Generic 'main' routine so we don't stick a load of code inside a public macro.

listitem.simpara: the oaf iid of the factory
ammount of time to wait (miliseconds) after all objects have been released before quitting the main loop.

refsect2.title: BONOBO_FACTORY_INIT()
refsect2.para: Macro that expands to the code need to initialize an exe factory. Should be placed at the beginning of the main() function.

refsect2.title: BONOBO_ACTIVATION_FACTORY()
refsect2.para: Macro that includes all boiler-plate code necessary to create an exe type factory, including a main() function and a generic factory.

listitem.simpara: Version string of the factory program
Additional data to be passed to the callback

refsect2.title: BONOBO_ACTIVATION_FACTORY_TIMEOUT()
refsect2.programlisting: #define BONOBO_ACTIVATION_FACTORY_TIMEOUT(oafiid, descr, version, callback, data, quit_timeout)
refsect2.para: Like BONOBO_ACTIVATION_FACTORY(), but has an extra quit_timeout argument.

listitem.simpara: Version string of the factory program
Additional data to be passed to the callback

Ammount of time to wait (in milliseconds) before deciding to quit the factory. A larger value prevents frequent respawning of a new factory process when there are many consecutive one-time requests, so that your factory appears to start faster after the first time.
